page.title: 11McALPINE ASPHALT CO.
page.content: McAlpine Ashalt has been in Billinge since 1936 when they were the offices for the opencast mining there. They were United Asphalt and have recently been renamed. The offices and supply depot are at Billinge,the men they employ work throughout England, from the Airfield at Glasgow to a Motorway in Cornwall. They make their own asphalt from limestone or granite and bitumen,they have their own quarries for stone. At each site they have two sets of machinery,in case of breakdowns.To buy all the machinery to_day would cost about Â£5,000,000. The men employed come from all over, but mainly from Liverpool, Wigan area, there still being a few with homes in Ireland. A motorway costs Â£1,000,000 to tarmac one mile and it takes two and a half weeks to complete the mile.
